eu_initiatives: WVA follows the EU developments in the field of Animal Health and Welfare, Public Health and the Environment, in particular the relevant legislation like the Animal Health Law, the proposals for a new EU legislation on Veterinary Medicines and Medicated Feed
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
We work to promote animal health, animal welfare, and public health globally with the understanding that human, animal, and environmental health are intricately interconnected, through food, infectious and zoonotic diseases, research to improve human and animal lives, encroachment on wildlife habitat, and the human-animal bond that has existed throughout time. 
 
The WVA is the internationally recognized voice of global veterinary medicine working with partners around the world, including OIE, WHO, and FAO, to assure improved health and welfare for humans, animals, and the environment we share together.
relevant_communication:
Important WVA communication channels are the Association's website, e-News and the organisation  of World Veterinary Congresses.  
 
The 2018 World Veterinary Congress will be held in the EU, in Barcelona, Spain.
